pr_title: GH #562: Remove config dependency on ZooKeeper (not ZooKeeper the service)

timeline.bodyText:
In line 18 above, it should be the case that this line can be removed:
      CONTROL_CENTER_ZOOKEEPER_CONNECT: 'zookeeper:2181'
timeline.author: ybyzek

replies.bodyText: Great point, it has been removed in this commit
replies.author: awalther28

timeline.bodyText:
@awalther28  PLAINTEXT:// is not required because it reads from kafkastore.security.protocol which defaults to PLAINTEXT, https://docs.confluent.io/current/schema-registry/installation/config.html#kafkastore-security-protocol.  If there are multiple SR security types, then this would come into play...but it does not come into play for this specific tutorial.
Is the leaning to include PLAINTEXT:// to be explicit?  The other consideration might be to omit it to lean towards simplicity.
timeline.author: ybyzek
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -38,13 +38,12 @@ services:
     hostname: schema-registry
     container_name: schema-registry
     depends_on:
-      - zookeeper
       - broker
     ports:
       - "8081:8081"
     environment:
       SCHEMA_REGISTRY_HOST_NAME: schema-registry
-      SCHEMA_REGISTRY_KAFKASTORE_CONNECTION_URL: 'zookeeper:2181'
+      SCHEMA_REGISTRY_KAFKASTORE_BOOTSTRAP_SERVERS: 'PLAINTEXT://broker:9092'

replies.bodyText: @ybyzek I have a leaning to include PLAINTEXT:// because I don't think it detracts from simplicity and doesn't rely on default values which can change in future versions (albeit changing default security protocols would be pretty disruptive and unlikely 😉 ). This is not a hill I'm willing to die on. I'm okay with changing this to 'broker:9092' since that is often how the brokers are referenced in other places throughout the repo.
replies.author: awalther28
